json_ref: STATIC::Gen Info 3::Gen Info 3|Late Fees|1st Late Fee Calculation Method
instructions:
Task
- Using the input field document_text (a lease or policy excerpt), output a single classification string for late_fees_calculation_method that describes how late fees are calculated.

Inputs
- document_text: A string that may be a full lease, an excerpt, or even be empty.

Output
- late_fees_calculation_method: A single string from the controlled vocabulary below.
- Do not output any other fields or reasoning. Output only the value of late_fees_calculation_method exactly as specified (case and punctuation must match).

Controlled vocabulary (use exact strings)
- % Owed-Total — Late fee is calculated as a percentage of the unpaid/overdue amount (balance due, rent owed, etc.).
- % Rent — Late fee is calculated as a percentage of the monthly/base rent amount (not specifically tied to only the unpaid balance).
- Flat Fee — A single fixed dollar amount charged once when late.
- Per Day $ — A fixed dollar amount that accrues per day late.
- Per Day % — A percentage amount that accrues per day late.
- Hybrid (Flat + Per Day $) — A flat dollar amount plus an additional per-day dollar amount.
- Greater Of ($ vs %) — The fee is the greater of a specified dollar amount or a percentage.
- None — The text explicitly states there is no late fee.

Mapping rules and cues
- Map to % Owed-Total when you see phrases like:
  - “X% of the unpaid rent”
  - “X% of the balance due”
  - “X% of the total amount owed”
  - “X% of any installment that is late”
  - “X% of rent due and unpaid”
  - “X% of outstanding rent”
- Map to % Rent when you see:
  - “X% of the monthly rent,” “X% of base rent,” or a percentage explicitly tied to the monthly/base rent (not limited to unpaid balance).
- Map to Flat Fee when you see:
  - “a late fee of $X,” “a fixed late charge of $X,” with no per-day accrual.
- Map to Per Day $ when you see:
  - “$X per day,” “an additional $X each day late,” etc.
- Map to Per Day % when you see:
  - “X% per day,” “accrues at X% daily,” etc.
- Map to Hybrid (Flat + Per Day $) when both a one-time flat amount and a per-day dollar accrual are present (e.g., “$50 plus $5 per day”).
- Map to Greater Of ($ vs %) when phrased as:
  - “the greater of $X or Y% (of rent/amount owed).”
- Map to None only if the text clearly states no late fee or that late fees are prohibited.

Tie-breakers
- If multiple methods are mentioned, choose the most specific structure. Examples:
  - “$50 plus $5/day” → Hybrid (Flat + Per Day $)
  - “Greater of $50 or 5%” → Greater Of ($ vs %)
- If % is clearly applied to unpaid/overdue amounts, prefer % Owed-Total over % Rent.

Absent, ambiguous, or empty text
- Do not output “Not determinable,” “Unknown,” or any free-form text.
- If the document_text is empty, missing, or the method is ambiguous/unclear, default to: % Owed-Total

Formatting requirements
- Output only the exact classification string (no labels, no JSON, no explanations). For example:
  % Owed-Total
